title: Grand Theft Auto III
notes: Crashes at the beggining, an error pops up and then the game closes.

title: Grand Theft Auto III
notes:
The game will run (sometimes you need manually switch the focus to the Wine window for the game).

I had issues with a xbox360 controller plugged in (in-game screen kept rotating around). With no controller plugged in: the screen follows mouse-movement as normal. 

There is a kind of blur effect in-game, which makes the screen unclear when there is movement (camera movement, moving the character in-game). 
In my memory of playing this game on Windows, there was no such blurring effect on Windows.

title: Grand Theft Auto III
notes:
You have to press the Enter button 2x at startup to able to start a game.
Video rendering performance issues (sometimes stutters. sometimes stable 30 fps with frame limiter On).sometimes the game window losts focus(?) and cannot turn the character with the mouse.

title: Grand Theft Auto III
notes: Game runs flawlessly in 1920x1080. When game launches, wait for screen to blink, then click mouse button twice to start the game. Go to the video settings and change resolution, maximize draw distance and turn frame limiter off. If you are annoyed with the blur effect (it was present in win version), turn trails off. Only issue I found is that you can't save game as the GTA3 want to save it in My Documents which really sucks.

title: Grand Theft Auto III
notes: Alt + Enter needed at startup, little lags
After a screen blink, continously press Esc and Enter to start the game. Game works perfectly after that. CLEO scripts don't seem to work.

title: Grand Theft Auto III

notes: Alt-enter to start. Had problems with camera rotating and pointing at the ground unless I unplugged my controller. And cannot change resolution.
title: Grand Theft Auto III

notes:
Intro movies do not work, leading to a seemingly unresponsive system. Pressing enter a few times skips them and brings you to the main menu. Everything is as it should be from then on.

Tested at 4k (3840x2160) with maximum draw distance. Saving and loading work.

(Might require installation of S3TC driver components on non-Nvidia setups)
title: Grand Theft Auto III

notes: You have to press a button after it launches to get your screen to change to the full screen game (I press space or enter). Sometimes it makes system unresponsive when you choose to quit the game. Tab out and close from your taskbar instead. Otherwise it plays perfectly for me. Mods works as well (Silent Patch, controller support, widescreen fix). https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=641839127
